conbody.p: You match views by placing them side by side to create a new view based on values in a common column.

example.title: Matching views
example.p: In this example you match two views. The first view contains product information.
The second view contains product prices.
When you match the views, Ormetis Professional Edition automatically recognizes the common column, Product.
Ormetis Professional Edition does not include row 4 from the view containing the prices because there is no matching product in the view containing the products.
example.note: Ormetis Professional Edition recognizes common columns even when the name of the common column is not the same in both views, by matching on data values.
